question.title: Messages not removed from Gmail inbox despite using expunge in jakarata mail Java code
question.body:
After loading my application's client secrets

GoogleClientSecrets clientSecrets = GoogleClientSecrets.load(JSON_FACTORY, isr);

I am able to successfully authenticate using XAOATH2 and get an IMAP based Session, jakarta.mail.Store, jakarta.mail.Folder for the inbox, and a list of messages

Store store = session.getStore("imaps");
Folder folder = store.getFolder("inbox");
Message[] msgs = folder.getMessages();

This all works perfectly, and I'm not inclined to change over to using Google API.

If I selectively decide I want to remove a message, I set the deleted flag

msgs[i].setFlag(Flag.DELETED, true);

if I don't set the delete flag, I set the seen flag to false

msgs[i].setFlag(Flag.SEEN, false);

In the finally code block, I call the following, which I thought should manage any messages where the delete flag was set

folder.expunge();  // I tried with and without this line with no apparent difference in behavior
folder.close(true);
store.close();

Unexpected: Messages where the delete flag is set are still in the inbox.

The logging does not appear to contain anything indicating a problem, but I thought someone who has experience with this might see something in the log that indicates why the messages I am trying to delete are not deleted.

A3 OK [READ-WRITE] inbox selected. (Success)
1 messages found.
--------------------------
A4 FETCH 1 (ENVELOPE INTERNALDATE RFC822.SIZE)
* 1 FETCH (RFC822.SIZE 10309 INTERNALDATE "11-Jun-2025 17:03:48 +0000" ENVELOPE ("Wed, 11 Jun 2025 17:03:46 +0000" "message subject here" (("message sender here" NIL "message recipeient here" "sender domain here"))(snip)
A4 OK Success
MESSAGE #1:message subject here (snip)
subject now [shortened subjec there (snip)]
A5 FETCH 1 (BODYSTRUCTURE)
* 1 FETCH (BODYSTRUCTURE (("TEXT" "PLAIN" ("CHARSET" "UTF-8" "DELSP" "yes" "FORMAT" "flowed") NIL NIL "BASE64" 910 19 NIL NIL NIL)("TEXT" "HTML" ("CHARSET" "UTF-8") NIL NIL "QUOTED-PRINTABLE" 3094 62 NIL NIL NIL) "ALTERNATIVE" ("BOUNDARY" "000000000000cff8c806374ecbeb") NIL NIL))
A5 OK Success
A6 FETCH 1 (BODY[2]<0.3094>)
* 1 FETCH (FLAGS (\Seen) BODY[2]<0> {3094}
<table border=3D"0"(snip)</tr></table>)
A6 OK Success
bodyText
Email message here (snip)
A7 STORE 1 +FLAGS (\Deleted)
* 1 FETCH (FLAGS (\Seen \Deleted))
A7 OK Success
removed email message with the code. << My Logging from Java
A8 EXPUNGE
* 1 EXPUNGE
* 0 EXISTS
A8 OK Success
A9 CLOSE
A9 OK Returned to authenticated state. (Success)
DEBUG IMAPS: added an Authenticated connection -- size: 1
Folder closed. << My Logging from Java
DEBUG IMAPS: IMAPStore cleanup, force false
A10 LOGOUT
* BYE LOGOUT Requested
A10 OK 73 good day (Success)
DEBUG IMAPS: IMAPStore cleanup done
Store closed. << My Logging from Java

Question: What do I need to change in my code, short of switching to Gmail API, to get the messages to actually be removed from the inbox?
